business.headline: EPFO to refund Rs 1,000 or less in inactive accounts: Who is eligible?At present, there are around 31 lakh inoperative EPFO accounts. Out of these, nearly six lakh accounts have Rs 1,000 or less deposited.

Will AI impact your appraisals this year? Here's how much you can expectArtificial intelligence is playing a growing role in shaping compensation models. Around 50 to 60% of large organisations now use data analytics when planning salaries and bonuses.
Sensex, Nifty end after strong rally, but IT stocks limit gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 479.95 points to end at 83,290.81, while the NSE Nifty50 added 141.75 points to close at 25,713.00.

Claiming HRA for rent to family? What draft tax rules may changeMany salaried employees claim HRA for rent paid to family members. While the practice remains allowed, proposed tax rules may bring an extra layer of scrutiny. Here's what could change.

Should India be concerned about the rise in gold and silver prices?The Finance Minister said gold has always been a favoured investment for Indian households. Demand often rises during festival seasons such as Akshaya Tritiya and other auspicious occasions.

Big housing boost for Gurugram, overtakes Mumbai in 2025 ultra luxury salesGurugram appears to be at the centre of India's ultra-luxury housing story, and the momentum suggests that demand for high-value homes is far from slowing down.

Has RERA lost its bite? What homebuyers need to knowThe Supreme Court has come down hard on real estate regulatory authorities (RERA), saying they should be abolished as they appear to favour builders and have failed to protect homebuyers, which is their intended purpose.

How a fake ITR refund message led to a Rs 1.5 lakh lossIt started with a simple message about a pending tax refund. Within minutes, a taxpayer had lost Rs 1.5 lakh. The case reveals how scammers are exploiting refund anxiety.

Are you saving enough for retirement? Why the Rs 1 crore target is outdatedMany Indians underestimate how fast expenses rise after 60 and how long their savings must last. A new study analyses how inflation, longevity and market risks reshape the real retirement corpus you need.

Selling your gold or silver mutual fund? Read this before you pay taxThinking of selling your gold or silver fund after the recent price rise? Before you click that sell button, have a closer look at the tax rules. Even a small timing mistake can change your tax bill significantly.

Completed 60 months of continuous cover? Your insurer may not deny your claimThe Insurance Regulatory Authority and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) has passed a historic reform cutting the moratorium period from eight years to five years.

How a routine account request revealed a Rs 590-crore fraud at IDFC First BankWhat began as a simple balance check has now expanded into a Rs 590-crore reconciliation exercise, a regulatory disclosure, multiple internal meetings at the highest levels of the bank, and a sharp selloff in the lender's stock.

IDFC First Bank shares crash nearly 20% after Rs 590 crore fraudIDFC Bank share price hit a lower circuit shortly after the opening bell, a clear sign of the anxiety that swept through the market. Read on to find out more about the suspected fraud.

UPL share price tumbles 12%: Why is the stock falling today?The stock was down around 12%, sliding toward mid-Rs 600 levels on the Bombay Stock Exchange after the market opened, underscoring fresh concerns on Dalal Street about the path ahead.
Sensex jumps 500 points: Why is stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex was up 630.25 points to 83,444.96, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 190.55 points to 25,761.80 as of 9:39 am.
Sensex, Nifty cheers as US Supreme Court turns down Trump tariffsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 630.25 points to 83,444.96, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 190.55 points to 25,761.80 as of 9:39 am.

Clean Max Enviro Energy vs Shree Ram Twistex IPO: Where to invest? Check GMPFor investors looking at listing gains, the grey market premium trend offers an early signal. But the two IPOs are very different in size, structure and current sentiment.

Sensex, Nifty today: Why stock market is likely to open higher and rallyGift Nifty futures were trading at 25,744.5 at 7:51 am. This points to the benchmark Nifty50 opening above Friday's close of 25,571.25. The Sensex had also ended last week with modest gains.

India, US reschedule chief negotiators meeting on interim trade deal: ReportThe Indian team was earlier scheduled to start the three-day meeting on February 23 in the US. Joint Secretary in the Commerce Ministry, Darpan Jain, is the chief negotiator of India for this agreement.

JPMorgan concedes it closed Trump's accounts after January 6 attackUntil now, JPMorgan had never admitted that it closed Donald Trump's accounts in writing after January 6. The bank would only speak hypothetically about when the bank closes accounts and its reasons for closing accounts, citing bank privacy laws.

entertainment.headline: One Battle After Another on OTT: When and where to watch Leonardo DiCaprio's film Acclaimed political action thriller One Battle After Another, directed by Paul Thomas Anderson and starring Leonardo DiCaprio and others, is set for its digital debut. The film's OTT release follows major wins at BAFTA 2026.

Composer Prateek Rajagopal on Bollywood debut with Tu Yaa Main and Hollywood dream After spending six years in the US, composer Prateek Rajagopal has started his journey in Indian cinema with Bejoy Nambiar's Tu Yaa Main. In an interview with India Today, he spoke about his friendship with Nambiar, his Hollywood dreams and why success in the entertainment industry takes patience.
Ranveer Singh moves Karnataka High Court to quash Kantara 'Daiva' mimicry case Ranveer Singh approached the Karnataka High Court, seeking to scrap the case against him for mimicking Kantara's Daiva.

Farhan Akhtar on playing Pandit Ravi Shankar in The Beatles biopic: Who isn't a fan Farhan Akhtar opened up about playing Pandit Ravi Shankar in The Beatles biopic. He also spoke about being excited over his first-time collaboration with director Sam Mendes.

Is Vijay's Jana Nayagan eyeing June release amid censor delay? Here's what we know Vijay's Jana Nayagan faces further delay due to pending CBFC certification. The film's makers now target a new release date, coinciding with Vijay's birthday and the Muharram holiday.

Moment of immense joy for Manipur: PM Modi on Boong's BAFTA victory Prime Minister Modi congratulated the team of Manipuri film Boong on its historic BAFTA win, celebrating it as a proud moment for Manipur and Indian cinema.

Shekhar Kapur: Boong better than main BAFTA winners, need to push Indian awards Lakshmipriya Devi's Boong received the Best Children's and Family Film honour at the BAFTA Awards. Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur voiced strong support for the film and highlighted its distinction among this year's winners.

Aavesham director Jithu Madhavan says project with Suriya is a proper Tamil film Director Jithu Madhavan confirms Suriya 47 as a Tamil action-comedy featuring an eccentric police team. The film balances humour with serious cases, clarifying earlier Malayalam sensibility rumours.

Farah Khan's Google Giggle moments with Sundar Pichai: See pics Farah Khan met Google CEO Sundar Pichai during a special interaction hosted by YouTube India and later shared cheerful moments from the meeting on social media. She described it as a "Google giggle" moment.

Rajpal Yadav returns to film set after 12 days in jail, shares post to fans After spending 12 days in Tihar Jail over a cheque bounce case, Rajpal Yadav has returned to the film set. He expressed gratitude to his fans and well-wishers.

Means a lot to the dreamers: Farhan Akhtar reacts as Boong wins at BAFTA The Manipuri-language film Boong has won the BAFTA Award for Best Children and Family Film. It marked the only Indian win at the 79th British Academy Film and Television Arts Awards in London.

Our Universe review: Roh Jeong-eui, Bae Hyuk-woo's Kdrama is sincere but scatteredRelease Date:Wed Feb 04, 2026 Our Universe K-drama review: Our Universe explores two young adults unexpectedly raising a child together. The show highlights the challenges and growth involved in reluctant co-parenting.

Kangana Ranaut to Karan Johar, celebs react to Boong's historic win at BAFTA 2026 Boong became the first Indian film to win a BAFTA in the Best Children's and Family Film category. Several celebrities including Karan Johar, Kangana Ranaut, Shekhar Kapur, Dia Mirza and Siddharth congratulated director Lakshmipriya Devi and the team on social media.

After AR Rahman calls Chhaava divisive, writer says films don't change mindsets Chhaava writer Rishi Verma addressed AR Rahman calling the film "divisive." The writer highlighted the film's popularity among the audience, and commented on whether cinema can influence people.

Actor Raj B Shetty clarifies role in Pocket Novel, says he is not the antagonist Actor Raj B Shetty confirmed that he will not play an antagonist in Thiagarajan Kumararaja's upcoming Tamil film Pocket Novel. He also talked about his admiration for the filmmaker and Ilaiyaraaja.

Hussain Dalal on working with Shahid in O'Romeo: He does all the heavy lifting In an exclusive interaction with India Today, actor-writer Hussain Dalal opened up about his experience of working on a Vishal Bhardwaj set. He also reflected on sharing screen space with Shahid Kapoor, praising him as the finest co-star.

Samantha talks about healing after divorce and finding love again in Raj Nidimoru Actor Samantha Ruth Prabhu discussed her emotional journey following her split from Naga Chaitanya. She highlighted how her relationship with Raj Nidimoru has helped her embrace vulnerability and find happiness again.

Nani's The Paradise unveils Aaya Sher promo ahead of 2026 release Nani's The Paradise has released the promo for its first single, Aaya Sher. The move builds excitement ahead of the film's August 2026 release and highlights Nani's character introduction.

Did you know Akshay Kumar was beaten up for singing to his college crush? Can you even imagine Akshay Kumar being beaten up over a girl? The actor recently recalled a college-time incident where serenading his crush outside her house ended with him and his friend getting thrashed by her neighbours.

general news.headline: Reducing cutoff does not affect competence: Government to Supreme Court amid row over NEET PG negative scorersReducing cutoff does not affect competence: Government to Supreme Court amid row over NEET PG negative scorers

HAL denies Tejas crash, says it was minor technical snag on groundHAL denies reports of Tejas crash, calling it a minor technical incident as IAF prepares for crucial Mk1A assessment in April. The focus remains on ensuring safety and combat readiness amid fleet losses and delays.

She wanted sugar daddy: Bengaluru gang-rape accused alleges extortionPolice are probing competing claims in the Bengaluru villa case after an accused alleged an extortion attempt, while the woman has accused two men of gang-raping her during a Valentine's Day party.

How a routine account request revealed a Rs 590-crore fraud at IDFC First BankWhat began as a simple balance check has now expanded into a Rs 590-crore reconciliation exercise, a regulatory disclosure, multiple internal meetings at the highest levels of the bank, and a sharp selloff in the lender's stock.

OpenClaw AI agent goes rogue deleting messages from engineer's Gmail, says sorryCan you rely on AI? The answer to this question is still not a hard YES. For example, OpenClaw, Silicon Valley's latest AI obsession, went a little too far for one Meta senior executive recently after its agent deleted emails from her Gmail without approval. Although, later it did say "sorry."

T20 WC: Why India's loss to South Africa could be a blessing disguised in bruisesFor India, the task now is to sift through the wreckage, rebuild momentum and remember that even champions must, occasionally, be humbled

How Mexican drug lord El Chapo, the Shorty, made it to Forbes listThere is mayhem in Mexico after the killing of drug cartel chief El Mencho, which shows the immense power organised crime has in the country. One kingpin, Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman, even made it to Forbes' rankings. But how did Mexico become a cartel stronghold? What role did its geography and China play?

Yunus's actions totally illegal: Bangladesh President, now free, exposes dark plotsBangladesh President Mohammed Shahabuddin has revealed how Muhammad Yunus, the chief adviser to the interim administration, plotted to remove him, didn't allow him to travel abroad and kept him in the dark on the US trade deal. The President said he surprisingly got support from the BNP top leadership.

Rashmika-Vijay arrive in Udaipur with family ahead of February 26 wedding. PicsRashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda arrived at the Udaipur airport on February 23. Their family members accompanied them as they are prepared for their grand wedding later this week.

5 bullets in IIT hostel, one big question: Are India's top institutes truly safe?A major security breach at IIT Bombay's Powai campus has raised fresh concerns after a 23-year-old man was arrested for storing live 7.65 mm cartridges inside a hostel room. The incident highlights serious lapses in identity verification, campus access control, and surveillance systems at one of India's premier educational institutions.

Ex-Prince Andrew got massage services and UK taxpayers paid for themFormer UK trade envoy Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested last week on suspicion of misconduct in public office. As per claims by former civil servants, Andrew's his overseas travel and support staff were funded by taxpayers.
Earth rotates at 1,670 km per hour, so why don't we feel it?We examine why the Earth's constant spin goes completely unnoticed by the people living on it. We think about it and then forget.

Gutter, but of gold. Why Dharavi slums charge Rs 5 lakh rent a monthThe towers of Mumbai have seen kilometres of expanse of Dharavi's asbestos and tin roofs for decades. Most pity the slums as a place that is deprived of the basics, while others romanticise them. As Asia's largest shanty town stands at the cusp of a major overhaul, it's humming with enterprise. Beyond the filth, Dharavi runs businesses that generate a billion dollars a year.

They come to steal: US radical right spews hate as Indian gets 18 years in jailAn Indian national, Atharva Shailesh Sathawane, was in January sentenced to 18 years in prison in the US for defrauding senior citizens. Nearly a month later, his case has been taken up by MAGA commenters to rail against foreign immigration and Indians in the US.

Cigarette-like health warning on fish, chicken next?Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha has linked meat and fish sales near schools to violence among children. The claim lacks scientific backing and raises concerns about nutrition, hygiene policy, and dietary freedom. The minister's remarks also risk politicisation of food habits in a country already battling protein deficiency.
Ranveer Singh moves Karnataka High Court to quash Kantara 'Daiva' mimicry caseRanveer Singh approached the Karnataka High Court, seeking to scrap the case against him for mimicking Kantara's Daiva.

Inside the mind of the man who redefined Indian wedding filmsYou have probably heard of Vishal Punjabi because of big celebrity weddings — Deepika Padukone–Ranveer Singh, Anushka Sharma-Virat Kohli. But this piece goes beyond the star names to unpack the craft and the man behind the camera.

Rahul Gandhi said he'd join my gym: 'Mohammad' Deepak after members' exodusRahul Gandhi met Kotdwar gym trainer Mohammad Deepak Kumar weeks after a Republic Day dispute over a shop's name triggered communal tensions.

Cow milk better for IQ than buffalo milk? Minister's claim meets scientific scrutinyA Rajasthan minister's viral claim linking cow's milk to sharper intelligence has ignited debate. Experts weigh in on what science actually says about cow milk, buffalo milk, and children's brain development.

ED now has a target, here's how many chargesheets they need to fileField units were directed to prioritise mature cases for filing final prosecution complaints and cut delays, aiming to complete most new investigations within one to two years, except in complex cases. A 500-complaint target was set, with zones told to gear up for an even higher goal next financial year.

5 Nobel nominations, no award: Meghnad Saha, the genius who decoded the starsMeghnad Saha was nominated for the Nobel Prize five times but never received it. Yet his ionisation equation, decoding how stars shine and what they are made of, became the foundation of modern astrophysics. Here is the story of the Indian physicist who transformed how we understand stars, and was left out of science's biggest honour.

Moment of immense joy for Manipur: PM Modi on Boong's BAFTA victoryPrime Minister Modi congratulated the team of Manipuri film Boong on its historic BAFTA win, celebrating it as a proud moment for Manipur and Indian cinema.

Drugged, gang-raped at Bengaluru villa party: Teen accuses Instagram friendThe complaint was filed after the survivor said continued trauma compelled her to seek medical help and inform her family. Police have since booked the two men named in her statement.

India issues fresh 'leave Iran' advisory amid fears of possible US strikeIndia has advised its nationals in Iran to leave the country using available transport, including commercial flights, as tensions escalate and fears grow of a possible US military strike.

sports.headline: ZIM vs WI Super 8 Live Score: Zimbabwe bowl first, Ngarava replaces Masakadza Zimbabwe (ZIM) vs West Indies (WI), T20 World Cup Super 8 Live Score: Zimbabwe have won the toss and opted to bowl first in Mumbai. Richard Ngarava has returned in place of Wellington Masakadza. West Indies have brought back Romario Shepherd for Roston Chase.

Australia return for Tests in South Africa, 8 years after Sandpapergate Australia are set to tour South Africa for an ODI and Test series in September and October later this year. The Aussies have not played a series in South Africa since the infamous Sandpapergate scandal in 2018.

Jammu and Kashmir eye historic title, Karnataka target ninth crown Ranji Trophy Final: Jammu and Kashmir will need to pull off a giant-sized miracle against eight-time champions Karnataka if they are to win their first-ever title over the next five days, starting Monday.

SA dragged India along the ground and insulted them: Former Pakistan cricketer South Africa handed India their first T20 World Cup defeat after 12 wins with a 76-run victory. The loss has raised questions over India's batting strategy and tournament prospects.

New Zealand's Mitchell banks on India's '2nd favourite' tag for semi-final push New Zealand all-rounder Daryl Mitchell said his side was ready to embrace their tag as Indian cricket fans' "second favourite team" as they attempt to steer through a demanding Super Eight group and return to the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup.

Who is Vaishnavi Adkar? Pune star becomes India's No.2 with dream run in Bengaluru Vaishnavi Adkar had a remarkable run at the ITF Women's W100 Open in Bengaluru, finishing as the runner-up. The 21-year-old also rose to become India's No. 2 ranked player following this impressive performance.

South Africa expose India's real problem: Accelerators without Kohli-type engine T20 World Cup: Surya Kumar Yadav smiled at a presser. South Africa had the last laugh. India's World Cup campaign is exposing a structural flaw no amount of aggression can hide.

Cupcake ad deleted, ego eaten: What is Star Sports serving next? T20 World Cup 2026: When the Cupcake promo disappeared after India's humbling defeat to South Africa in Ahmedabad, it symbolised more than embarrassment. The 'cupcake gate' has exposed how arrogance, hype, and disrespect have overtaken thoughtful storytelling in cricket broadcasting.

ZIM vs WI, Super 8 preview: India watch closely as confident sides clash in Mumbai T20 World Cup 2026, West Indies vs Zimbabwe Super 8 preview: Two-time champions West Indies will look to continue their resurgent run when they face an inspired Zimbabwe side that stunned Sri Lanka and Australia last week. India, who suffered a 76-run defeat to South Africa on Sunday, will also keep a close eye on this contest.

Zimbabwe not worried about lack of experience in India: Raza sends Super 8 warning Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza dismissed concerns about his team's limited recent T20I experience in India, expressing confidence that they possess the belief and capability to produce a "top performance" in the Super Eights of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

Who said Zimbabwe was not supposed to be here? Sammy reacts to Super 8 pre-seeding West Indies head coach Daren Sammy on Sunday said Zimbabwe may have drawn extra motivation from being clubbed with higher-seeded sides Sri Lanka and Australia in Group B.

ECB warns Indian-owned The Hundred teams over shadow-ban on Pakistan playersEngland Cricket Board has issued a reminder to The Hundred franchises of their obligations under anti-discrimination regulations, while reports keep emerging of Indian-owned franchises ignoring Pakistan players in the upcoming auction.

South Africa were prepared for India's Varun Chakravarthy threat: David MillerT20 World Cup: South Africa batter David Miller explained how the Proteas did their homework about facing India's spin threat Varun Chakravarthy in the Super 8 clash in Ahmedabad, which ended up paying big dividends for the side in their dominant win om Sunday. Miller voiced pride on South Africa's overall brilliance shown against the defending champions.

India coach clarifies controversial Axar Patel snub after losing to South AfricaT20 World Cup: India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said the Axar Patel snub was a tactical call based on match-ups and the need for extra batting depth. He insisted the decision was not a reflection of Axar's value or leadership.

Mohammad Amir clarifies slogger remark, sends message to Abhishek SharmaT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir acknowledged that many were upset when he called Abhishek Sharma a slogger. The left-arm pacer also sent a public message to the out-of-form India opener, who struggled during India's defeat to South Africa in a Super 8 match on Sunday.

How can you forget what Axar has done? Ashwin slams vice-captain's snub after SA lossT20 World Cup: Ravichandran Ashwin criticised India's decision to bench Axar Patel in the Super 8 defeat to South Africa. The former spinner said stability, not overthinking match-ups, wins ICC tournaments.

Missed Virat Kohli? When India went searching for 300 in a 188-run chaseIND vs SA, T20 World Cup Super 8: This wasn't about Virat Kohli's absence. It was about India's absence of game awareness, as poor decisions, rigid tactics, and reckless batting turned a manageable chase into humiliation.

T20 World Cup: Cringe cupcake ad taken off after India lose to South AfricaT20 World Cup: A pre-match cupcake ad mocking South Africa resurfaced after India's 76-run loss in Ahmedabad. The defeat not only dented pride but also left India's semi-final hopes hanging by Net Run Rate.

Tilak Varma disappointed me: Sunil Gavaskar slams batter's approach in SA lossT20 World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar questioned Tilak Varma's shot selection after India's heavy Super 8 defeat to South Africa. The former captain felt the chase required patience, not early risk-taking.

Showed that India is beatable: David Miller proud of South Africa's Super 8 winT20 World Cup: David Miller said South Africa proved India are beatable after their 76-run Super 8 win in Ahmedabad. The Proteas veteran credited discipline, experience and sticking to simple plans for the statement victory.

How South Africa plotted India's downfall right under their nose in AhmedabadIndia vs South Africa, T20 World Cup: The 100,000 fans in Ahmedabad fell silent again as India were defeated by South Africa in the Super 8s of the T20 World Cup. Ironically, the Proteas planned India's downfall right under their nose, and the Men in Blue did not even see it coming.

India served humble pie as South Africa smash the cupcake right back at usA playful dig is one thing. But when the broadcaster mocked South Africa's history of painful exits, they handed the opposition a motivation that no dressing room team talk ever could.

Sanju Samson back? Coach hints at changes after Abhishek, Tilak flop vs SAIndia suffered a heavy defeat against South Africa in their T20 World Cup Super 8 fixture. Following their loss, the team is considering recalling Sanju Samson to address persistent opening batting failures.

Gavaskar, Pollock slam India's one-dimensional batting: Threw bat at everythingFormer cricketers Gavaskar and Pollock criticised India's batting approach after a heavy defeat to South Africa in the T20 World Cup. The loss ended India's 12-match winning streak and raised questions over their adaptability and strategy.

Sunil Gavaskar calls for India's batters to be more than six-hitters after SA defeatFormer India cricketer, Sunil Gavaskar, in an exclusive interaction with Nikhil Naz on India Today, opened up on the batting unit of the Indian T20I side after the crushing 76-run defeat to South Africa in the Super 8 stages of the T20 World Cup. The batting legend called for the side led by Suryakumar Yadav to be more than just six-hitters and ones who can also play based on the conditions and the situation as well, when the conditions get tough.

Sundar Pichai says Gavaskar his idol. Batting great lifts lid on T20WC meetingIndian batting great Sunil Gavaskar shared details of his meeting with Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai during the Super Eights clash between India and South Africa in Ahmedabad on Sunday, after the tech leader described him as his childhood idol and recalled growing up with his posters on the wall.

Suryakumar blames poor batting for SA loss, refuses to abandon aggressive styleIndia suffered a heavy defeat against South Africa in the Super 8 fixture of the T20 World Cup 2026. India captain Suryakumar Yadav blamed team's poor batting show for the crushing loss.

T20 World Cup: Why India's semifinal chances look bleak after 76-run defeat to SASouth Africa handed India a crushing 76-run defeat at the Narendra Modi Stadium in the T20 World Cup 2026, pushing the Men in Blue into a tricky position with their semi-final spot now under serious threat. Here's a look at how they can still progress to the next round.

Ahmedabad heartbreak 2.0: SA bring India back to earth, hand massive Super 8 lossIndia vs South Africa, T20 World Cup: Ahmedabad continues to haunt India's unbeaten runs. On November 19, 2023, Australia ended their perfect ODI World Cup campaign at the final hurdle. On Sunday, South Africa repeated the script, snapping India's 12-match winning streak in the T20 World Cup, inflicting a crushing 76-run defeat on the hosts.

Gambhir slammed as India's Washington Sundar experiment fails vs South AfricaIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir faced criticism after Washington Sundar's underwhelming performance against South Africa in the T20 World Cup. The tactical choice to include Sundar over Axar Patel sparked debate over team selection and strategy.

Jasprit Bumrah stands out in Ahmedabad: 3 for 15 and a new T20 World Cup recordT20 World Cup 2026, IND vs SA Super 8: Jasprit Bumrah delivered a masterclass in control and craft, claiming three crucial wickets and conceding just 15 runs in his quota of four overs, but South Africa's late surge denied India complete dominance in Ahmedabad.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
